title: Peter Price statement to the Star: facts supporting

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Cllr Peter Price made a statement to the Star after the Lowcock report, I am seeking some information to better understand his statement:
“ In view of all the furore regarding the highway tree report and the call for resignations why has nobody bothered to mention the Shiregreen estate, the first area of the City back in 2012, to have all its roads, pavements, drains, street lights etc. renewed and many ofits highway trees
replaced with more suitable
ones. All with the support of the residents after several
meetings. We now have more highway trees in Shiregreen than we have ever had, more varieties and more suitable for our street environment
and in more suitable places. Some of the very large trees which left many homes in permanent shadow and damaged the pavements have been replaced, much to
satisfaction of the residents. Rather than calling for the resignation of Councillors Fox and Lodge Iwould like to thank them for all the work done on the Shiregreen estate.”
1. Can the council indicate: how many trees were felled on the Shiregreen Estate by Amey, and the number of replacements.
2. Could you please provide details, dates and and copy of the invitation/notice of these several meetings.
3. Could the council indicate in the Shiregreen Estate as referred to by Peter Price how many Trees were damaging the pavement? And that were replaced, please supply asset IDs for all identified.
Yours faithfully,
Marcus

as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please do not
hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,

Dear Mr Combie
Thank you for your request for information relating to trees on the
Shiregreen Estate, which we received on 10/04/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
We think that the works to which Cllr Peter Price refers to in his
statement in The Star, relate to the Shiregreen Environmental Improvement
Scheme undertaken by Sanctuary Housing Association, largely prior to the
commencement of the Streets Ahead contract rather than works undertaken
directly by Amey.
Files relating to the Shiregreen Environmental Improvement Scheme were
closed down and disposed of some very considerable period of time ago, and
no information relating to the scheme has been retained.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
